Data Fields
CSRMESH_SENSOR_WRITE_VALUE_T Struct Reference
CSRmesh&trade; » Models » Sensor Model

Writing Sensor Value: Upon receiving a SENSOR_WRITE_VALUE message, where the Type field is a supported sensor type, the device saves the value into the current value of the sensor type on this device and responds with a SENSOR_VALUE message with the current value of this sensor type.

Data Fields

sensor_type_t type
 Sensor type. The Type field is a 16-bit unsigned integer that determines the sensor type of the value.
 
CsrUint8 value [4/size_in_bytes(CsrUint8)]
 Sensor Value. The Value field is from 1 to 4 octets in length; the format of this field is determined by the Type field.
 
CsrUint8 value_len
 Length of the value field.
 
sensor_type_t type2
 Sensor type. The Type field is a 16-bit unsigned integer that determines the second sensor type of the value. This field is optional, and can be zero octets in length.
 
CsrUint8 value2 [4/size_in_bytes(CsrUint8)]
 Sensor Value. The Value field is from 1 to 4 octets in length; the format of this field is determined by the Type2 field. This field is optional, and can be zero octets in length.
 
CsrUint8 value2_len
 Length of the value2 field.
 
CsrUint8 tid
 Transaction identifier. The TID, or transaction identifier field is an 8-bit integer that identifies a given message with a known transaction from a source device.
